name: Beef Braciole
keywords: Beef, Braciole, Italian, Rich, Tomato, Parmesan, Prosciutto, Parsley, Pine Nuts, Dinner, Appetizer, Hearty, Rosemary, Wine, Winter
description: Fabulously rich beef roles with crispy prosciutto bits and a cheesy filling that kicks it into overdrive.
recipeIngredient: 6 thin slices Top Round Beef (Sizzle Steaks work well)
1 tbsp mixed chopped Rosemary, Thyme, Oregano

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the parsley, parmesan, breadcrumbs, pine nuts, and 3 of the garlic cloves.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix fillings

recipeInstructions.text: Lay down the steaks separately. Lay a slice of prosciutto on top of each steak. Sprinkle the parsley parmesan mix on top of the prosciutto, roll the steaks up tightly and put a skewer through to hold them in place.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a dutch oven on a stove top with the oil and brown the beef rolls. Remove the beef rolls and add in the wine, beef stock, herbs, leftover garlic, and tomatoes. Heat to a simmer and scrape the sticky bits off the bottom.
recipeInstructions.name: Brown rolls

recipeInstructions.text: Add beef rolls back in, cover, and put into the oven for 1h and 30m.
recipeInstructions.name: Braise

recipeInstructions.text: 10 minutes before the rolls come out, crisp up the remaining prosciutto and chop up some extra parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep to serve

recipeInstructions.text: Serve topped with crispy prosciutto, parsley, some toasted pine nuts, and a side of sourdough to soak up all the delicious juices.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Would also be good with some fresh chilis cooked in or topped with lemon zest for citrus kick.
